docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry said Monday that he would like to see the American-led military and diplomatic effort in Syria “go faster.”
docs.snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry said Monday that he would like to see the American-led military and diplomatic effort in Syria “go faster.”...
docs.abstract: Diplomatic Memo; Sec of State John Kerry says he supports more aggressive approach to combating Islamic State; tactfully affirms Pres Obama's current strategy, which critics say is too passive, noting that military involvement has recently been stepped up; hopes to involve Arab nations in negotiating cease-fire in Syrian civil war.

headline.print_headline: Kerry Adds Voice to Those Urging Bigger Push Against Islamic State in Syria
headline.main: John Kerry Adds Voice to Those Urging Bigger Push Against Islamic State in Syria

docs.lead_paragraph: Hard-line stances against admitting refugees to the United States are a mistake because they hurt law enforcement's ability to build ties within Muslim communities, Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton said on Monday.
docs.snippet: Hard-line stances against admitting refugees to the United States are a mistake because they hurt law enforcement's ability to build ties within Muslim communities, Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Rodham Clinton said on Monday....

headline.print_headline: Clinton: Stances Against Refugees Could Hurt Law Enforcement
headline.main: Clinton: Stances Against Refugees Could Hurt Law Enforcement

docs.lead_paragraph: Activist investor Bill Ackman's hedge fund has significantly increased its investment in Valeant Pharmaceuticals International, and signaled it may play a greater role in the beleaguered drugmaker’s strategy, according to a regulatory filing.

docs.lead_paragraph: A $160 billion deal announced Monday to merge Pfizer and Allergan and create the world's biggest drug company renewed the outcry in Washington over "inversions," in which U.S. corporations combine with companies overseas to lower their tax bill.
docs.snippet: A $160 billion deal announced Monday to merge Pfizer and Allergan and create the world's biggest drug company renewed the outcry in Washington over "inversions," in which U.S. corporations combine with companies overseas to lower their tax bill....

headline.print_headline: $160B Deal to Combine Pfizer and Allergan Raises Outcry
headline.main: $160B Deal to Combine Pfizer and Allergan Raises Outcry

docs.lead_paragraph: Campaigning in Martin Luther King Jr.'s hometown, Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders on Monday sought to position himself as a political heir of the slain civil rights leader.

docs.lead_paragraph: In the suit, Bradley F. Podliska contends the House Select Committee on Benghazi and Mr. Gowdy, its chairman, fired him illegally and defamed him.
docs.snippet: In the suit, Bradley F. Podliska contends the House Select Committee on Benghazi and Mr. Gowdy, its chairman, fired him illegally and defamed him....
docs.abstract: Bradley F Podliska, former investigator for House Select Committee on Benghazi, files lawsuit against panel and its chairman, Republican Rep Trey Gowdy of South Carolina, contending that they illegally fired and defamed him.

headline.print_headline: Castoff Sues House Panel on Benghazi
headline.main: Fired Investigator Sues House Benghazi Committee and Trey Gowdy

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. politicians condemned Pfizer Inc's deal with Allergan Plc as a tax dodge on Monday, bringing another round of hand-wringing in Washington over the corporate tax code, though legislative action before 2017 is unlikely.
